content: ¡°Great Location but not ideal for a Family stay.  Rooms too small...Staff not friendly¡±

content_detail: There is no Indian food restaurants nearby At times calls from room made to front desk goes un attended During weekends the lifts were fully occupied and we stayed in th floorLiterally i had to force my family to squeeze in the lift when it stopped in our floor and i had to take stairs Hotel is very close to Nicolle Highway Metro station which made our travel easy within city I would like to thank Mr Aloysius and Ms Pei Pei at the front Desk They were very helpful in providing tips on sight seeing locations We were allowed to early check-in The check in and check out process time takes less than  minutes The breakfast was good and it is continental, but it was bit boring to see the same menu daily The seating area for breakfast was very limited There is very less option for vegetarians and no option of Indian food, however one day we were lucky to get Channa and parathas All together the Hotel is in good location, clean but small rooms Room Service was good Just across the road there is Hawker food centre and there are no Indian food available But there is an restaurant adjacent to hawker centre which serves chicken, mutton and fish Biryani and the food was good Stayed in December

content: ¡°I would choose a different hotel next time¡±
content_detail: The free breakfast was not good  The problem was that food that should be hot like eggs were cold every morning  Food that should be cold like milk for cereal was warm every morning  The inability to keep the food at the proper temperature made the breakfast awful  In addition, I attended the breakfast  minutes before the posted closing of breakfast but found that many items had run out and were not replaced--You couldn't get bananas, muffins, Jam, and other items unless you asked a staff member to go into the kitchen and replenish the buffet  I think the staff should do this without having to be asked by the guest The staff were friendly and helpful  I had some business documents that I needed to print and scan and the staff at the front desk printed and scanned the documents for me which was very helpful  All staff I spoke with were friendly and niceStayed in December

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Couple<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 7 nights
content_detail: Bathroom was not cleaned every day and was getting bit dirty in the end of our stay (we stayed  nights) Very good location close to a metro station, great swimming pool on the roof, very nice and helpful staff We like to walk and from the hotel we were able to reach many sights by walking Great was the food centre just across the street with good and cheap foodStayed in November

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Group<U+2022> Triple Room<U+2022> Stayed 3 nights
content: ¡°Had a pleasant 4-day stay in this hotel.  Will consider staying here again.¡±
content_detail: Housekeeping could be improved:  washbasin looked like it hadn't been scrubbed well before our occupancy, found a child's toy under the bed which could mean that housekeeping staff hadn't vacuumed under the bed after the previous guests' departure, desk was a bit dusty upon our arrival  Didn't have separate container for shampoo/conditioner and shower gel in the shower so we didn't know if it was for the hair or body  Lock of sliding wooden door of the bathroom wasn't working (either broken or deliberately kept that way) which is a privacy concern if you're staying with mixed group  Definitely needs improvement:  repair of drain beside the toilet where bad smell emanates (had to change room because of this but even the new room given us had this problem) The bed was comfy  Pillows were soft, towels were fluffy and absorbent  Room was well insulated from noise Have lots of wall sockets including USB plugs and universal socket  Enough drawers and long desk  Our room has nice view of the river  Sufficient lighting and airconditioning unit working well  Conveniently located near shopping complex with taxi stand and hawker center Quiet neighborhood  Housekeeping was fast in delivering our requested items  We'd like to commend front desk staff, Pei Pei, for being accommodating and pleasantly answering our questionsStayed in November

content_detail: Location maybe is not the best for them who want to be in the center of everyrhingIt took about min daily to get to night life/shops etc  About  min walk to subway and then  stations to Marina bay, or around  stations to China townMy favourite Ralph Lauren swimming suite was never found after room cleaning I hope it wasn't stolen, but taken with the towels by accident, but the fact is that it was never returned back I am really disappointed with this fact as it is not accurate from personal's side I was asked several times about it and each time I had to explain same things from the beginning - describe suite, when it disappeared etc And this didn't had any results I was explained that laundry service is provided by another company But this doesn't mean anything when you loose your favourite thing Only pictures of suite on the rooftop are left Sad experience I liked the breakfast and the service Swimming pool on the rooftop was beautiful Area is quite There is some local food available in the next building and huge shopping store in  subway station Bugis if I am not mistaken, we bought clothes, some souvenirs, cosmetics etc from there Hotel is modern We stayed  days in the room on  floor, didn't experience any problems with lift, only once waiting was around - min All the rest time it was actually fastStayed in November

content_detail: Pretty much everything you would expect from a hotel in Singapore, Impeccable cleaning, quite spacious rooms, attention to details, good location, close to Marina Bay, and a big plus - there is an asian food court right outside the building, crossing the street, with cheap prices and very good foodStayed in September

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Family with young children<U+2022> Family Room<U+2022> Stayed 5 nights
content_detail: If you are looking for giant american rooms, and have lots of luggage, this is not for you The pillows were flat, but I am sure the hotel would have provided more This is a newish hotel ( years) and the taxis didn't know how to find it Show them on a map, or say next to golden tower on beach road If you say the address itself ( beach road), no problem, they'll get there That's it! Honestly a great stay! Great hotel, with very good beds The rooms were small (normal for singapore) but very well designed We traveled with only carry on, big suitcases might be a problem Air conditioner cools down the room quickly, quietly and very efficiently The hotel is right next to little thai, and a great hawker center There is a / kitty corner from it Taxi are readily available day and night The staff was super friendly, and really amicable No problem keeping our luggage at  AM while we visited the city! The lavender metro is - minutes walking, or Burgis (more connections) - minutes, while walking on very cool street You are right in the arabic part of town, with a great mosque and a palace nearby Little india is not far either Rooftop pool has great views,  meter deep Lots of room for sunbathing Lots of chairs Always enough towels By taxi, we were  minutes from the zoo,  minutes from sentosa, and about  minutes to the airport Taxis are really great in singapore Although breakfast was not included, it was worth it: lots of offerings, varying from continental to semi-local Highly recommended!Stayed in October

content: ¡°We loved the view from our room.¡±
content_detail: We loved the view from our room It overlooked the Marina and we could see the dragon boats during the weekend  The croissant and danish pastries served at breakfast were delicious! content: ¡°Great breakfast menu for Family, clean room, and good neighborhood location¡±
content_detail: We arrived at Lavender station, walked to the beach road and had to climb up the crossing bridge in front of the hotel  Thankfully we only brought small carry-on The nearest MRT station is Nicoll Highway but have to walk around changing stations Check-in was fast although the room is not ready at  noon  We left the bags at hotel reception Clean room, not too small with  beds, toilet with jet washer, quite complete facilities : safe deposit, refrigerator, hairdryer They can give  room key cards Breakfast menu quite extensive : Asian style with chinese porridge, Western style with sereal, milk, toasted bread, baked beans, scramble eggs, chicken sausage, bacon Three types of juices (not fresh ones, btw) salad, fruits, yogurts Although at  am they run out of salad n fruits Wifi is ok in the room, max  devicesOnly one bus away from Bugis Mall, well actually we can walk about  minutes Booked the low rate - no money back kinda risky, but since the rate include breakfast, is a good value !Stayed in October

tags: <U+2022> Business trip<U+2022> Solo traveller<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 4 nights<U+2022> Submitted via mobile
content: ¡°Good value for money. Can save you dough for restaurant walk-outs¡±
content_detail: Did not try breakfasts: - SGD seems to be to much for standard continental breakfastPool is closing at  pm - lights on rooftop go off and you can't enjoy the view at night No toilet on the roof levelNeed to cancel pre-authorization policy: I pay only cash and don't give my card details because of long release times in my country - freezing money for - days makes no sense, actually making you pay twice I had to settle this individually by contacting the property and getting decision for "one-time exception" Location: between Nicoll (yellow line) and Lavender (green line) stations means that you'll easily get here from airport via MRT and also reach main attractionsCleanliness: rooms are modern and clean Request for cleaning is done upon push of buttonLifts seem to be working faster than described in previous reviews, though the waiting time is still around - minsFriendly staff - allowed for a later checkout and overall helped with advice, but only after you ask themTea and coffee bags refilled regularly along with  bottles of water per dayStayed in September

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Couple<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 2 nights<U+2022> Submitted via mobile

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Group<U+2022> Family Room<U+2022> Stayed 5 nights
content_detail: The roof top pool, though very handy, is small and hardly luxurious The first room we were given (on the recommendation of the front desk) was supposed to have a river view but instead all we could see was the very ugly high rise building immediately behind the hotel We were very disappointed when we first saw it and felt it had been oversold! To be fair, when we asked if there was another room available (with a city view) the room was swapped and we were much happier with our new room Had there not been another one available we would have been very unhappy as, in effect, half the hotel's room have horrible views While there is nothing the hotel can do about that, it is pretty rich to say the rooms at the back have any kind of view and the price should reflect that The outstanding feature of the hotel is its location It is right in the heart of a vibrant part of the city, close to huge number of excellent restaurants and very handy for the MRT (Nicholl Highway stop) The rooms though are small and there was very limited space for luggage with a tiny wardrobe We didn't eat in the hotel (the price for breakfast was OTT) and there are several very good places nearby including a  hour  /  for everything you might need We felt very safe wandering around and absolutely loved SingaporeStayed in September

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Family with young children<U+2022> Triple Room<U+2022> Stayed 5 nights
content: ¡°Nice with good location. MRT and bus access very close by¡±
content_detail: The room booked was triple room However, it had  bed, which made the room extra congested with absolutely no space to walk or keep the luggage We managed as we were just tourists and only went back to sleep A more spread on breakfast would have been a bonus The staff was really courteous and accommodated us for an hour late check-out as our flight was late in evening They used to also send extra free water bottles whenever asked for Breakfast was niceStayed in September

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Couple<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 3 nights<U+2022> Submitted via mobile
content: ¡°An excellent location from which to vist this part of Singapore¡±
content_detail: Places to eat were within walking distances but we did have to walk two or three blocks to find one that we would enjoy Breakfast was a good start for the day, covering our dietary needs (vegetarian, European taste) but we felt it was a little expensiveWe used public transport a lot and found the MRT (metro) was excellent - very clean, well signed, helpful staff, quick and efficient, cheap We used a bus to get from the hotel to MacRichie National park with help from the tourist office You need to use Google Maps to find the right bus stops and where to get on and offStayed in September

content_detail: All my pre-arrival requests were granted from the extra pillows to the big bed to be pushed to the wall Everything was in order upon arrival Housekeeping never failed to make up our room and replenish everything everyday Exceptional service from the front desk to f&b especially the Filipina staff at the restaurant and Stomper Lim who even voluntarily put rice on my daughter's plate upon seeing me carrying my baby  He always checked on us every time we dine for breakfast, never failing to put a contagious smile and a pleasant demeanor He even gave my daughter a cute souvenir pen I won't hesitate booking here again the next time I visit sgStayed in September

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Couple<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 1 night
content: ¡°Excellent hotel for short stay in Singapore¡±
content_detail: The hotel is very busy and they probably need a larger breakfast area to accommodate the number of people staying The buffet breakfast is very good but they struggled to replenish a lot of food items sometimes, and so we had to wait for a while However all breakfast staff did their best and tried to be helpful This is a very busy high rise hotel in central Singapore It is a new hotel and therefore the accommodation is clean and modern, although the rooms are a little small All bathroom fittings were new and worked very well The staff are very efficient and friendly - I inadvertently left my handbag in the taxi taking us to this hotel and the staff immediately moved heaven and earth to get it returned to me, which they did This was amazing service The hotel is within walking distance of popular tourist destinations like Raffles and also very close to a train station where you can get transport further into town which we found very easy to use This is a very convenient hotel for a short stay in SingaporeStayed in August

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Family with young children<U+2022> Triple Room<U+2022> Stayed 2 nights

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Couple<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 2 nights

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Family with young children<U+2022> Family Room<U+2022> Stayed 3 nights
content_detail: We arrived early from a long flight from Paris and were very grateful to be able to check in several hours early From other reviews we understood that when the room was configured for  there would be almost no other space, the beds are more or less touching each other like one long bed and very little space for luggage etc Knowing this in advance we were able to plan and left our main suitcases at the "left luggage" storage facility at the airport, as we were only there for  days, our hand luggage was plenty This worked out really well, and we were very comfortable in our room We loved the rooftop pool, this added a touch of luxury and excitement for the children, extra towels were provided at the poolside which was a great service, and the opening hours were long enough to take advantage of it after a long day of sightseeing You can see a lot of view from the roof, including the Marina Bay Sands and the Domes Across the road (and there is an bridge from the lobby) there is the Golden Mile Hawker centre with many food options available, as well as a mall of sorts along the road We felt the location was great, easy to get aroundStayed in July

content_detail: Only problem I found was some taxi drivers didn't know where this hotel was Once you tell them the street they find it pretty easily, but I think the name recently changed and so they aren't as familiar with it yet Very nice business like hotel Reminds me of a Holiday Inn The bed was very comfortable, the shower was lovely, the breakfast was delicious Does the job very well All the amenities were nice, and the room was very clean The location was also great  MRT within walking distance, a really great Hawker Centre across the street, Arab Street is a few minutes walk away where you can find many bars and restaurants I really enjoyed my stay hereStayed in July

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Group<U+2022> 2 rooms<U+2022> Stayed 4 nights

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Couple<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 5 nights
content_detail: The cleanliness of the room could have been a bit better When we first went into our room the smell of the toilet was in a bad state I had also dropped something on the floor and when I bent down with a torch to search under the bed was greeted with a dusty carpet and left over items from previous guests The swimming pool at the roof is also very shallow at  meters (which may be beneficial or preferred to some people) The lifts were also extremely slow - you definitely had to wait several minutes before it arrives after pressing the button The breakfast area is also way to small for the number of guests the hotel accommodates for The breakfast buffet area was overly crowded and at times chaotic in the morning as several guests try to get their food in a non-orderly fashion I also witnessed an argument from guests who had taken other guest's tables at breakfast time as sometimes tables have to be shared due to the number of people The staff were helpful and friendly with all questions relating to the local area and accommodation  The hotel is situated approximately - minutes walk from Lavender Station which I found more well connected than the closest station which was about  minutes walk away There are /'s and other  hour stores a short walk away which was very convenient The breakfast buffet is a convenient way to get breakfast without having to go out I liked that they provided towels on the roof for the swimming pool and that the outdoor pool was very clean The wifi is also very good and I had no broken connections throughout my entire stayStayed in July

content_detail: Extra beds/mattresses are not provided  These should be provided  Rooms are a little compact  Microwave in the room would have been helpful  The reception is on the first level, so you would have to take an elevator or climb steps, which can be a little annoying at times  Also there is no grandness in the entrance of the hotel  There is no bellboy/staff service to assist you with the luggage, the same has to be managed on our own Cleanliness was nice  View from the room was awesome  Free mineral water saved a lot of money or effort to go and purchase  The staff was very courteous and helpful at all times  A short walking distance from MRT Station was helpful for easy commute  The entrance to the hotel is very practical, taxi can drop you right at the doorstep   Luggage carts are provided for transporting luggage within the hotel premises  Free wifi was helpfulStayed in July

content_detail: The dining room was closed other than breakfast due to renovations This renamed hotel had a large number of unruly families who thought nothing of allowing their children to door crash from room to room long after midnight whilst not the hotels fault, they did speak to these guests but it took a number of us barging into their unlocked rooms asking them to stop the screaming and put their children to bedFrom my last visit, they seemed to have made some contracts with a large ethnic group who have little regard for other guestsI hope this will be looked at in the future as I will still gladly stay again A nice no fuss  hotel, easy access to our rooms which were very comfy with an excellent bathroom a taxi rank right next door but no issues with the hotel arranging  taxis for our transfer to our cruise ship This hotel was a short taxi ride to the hop on hop off bus and other attractions with a supermarket next doorwe loved the Asian mall which allowed us to eat with the locals and very good it was tooStayed in June

content_detail: Space!! The room was great for  or two people The fact that we booked as a family would mean we need a bit more room This became an issue in the bathroom There was no space at all to put any toiletries Some extra bench space or shelving in there would have been greatAlso, the fridge never gets cold I think our water was lucky to get to about  degrees That was really annoying when you just want a nice cold drink Also, again, space Could only fit  small ml bottles of water in thereThe pool closes at pm which is slightly annoying The city doesn't stop until pm, so after a long day walking around taking in the city it wold have been nice to go back and chill in the pool for a little bit, but it closes at pm The elevator won't let you press Rooftop after that timeThe room didn't include breakfast A friend booked a room for  nights including breakfast and paid less than we did for  nights without breakfast, so that was really disappointing The rooftop pool was fantasticOne of the few places in Singapore that accommodates families and we could all get into one room Although a little squashy, it didn't bother us too much as we only really went back there to sleepIt is reasonably close to Nicholl Hwy MRT stationnoon checkout is so good!Stayed in June

content_detail: One of the rooms was not ready until  hours after check in time We had to go down and check constantly to see when it was available as staff were not in too much of a rush to have it ready The room was booked  months prior yet on the day could not give us side by side rooms as requested The room had not been cleaned properly A large water bottle was under the bed, used and unused tissues, crisps and rubbish When the foldaway bed was put away (which was touching the two beds because the room was so small) and after the cleaner had cleaned the room again, more crisps and rubbish were located on the floor The carpets were filthy and the bathroom dirty The toilet door could not lock as it was broken There was two adults in our room First day we received an adequate amount of towels and toiletries, upon cleaning they took all of the towels and replaced it with two More of an inconvenience than anything as we arrived home around pm from the night safari Free internet is provided at a slow speed If you want internet at a speed you can work with you must pay $ There's not too much good to come out of this hotel unfortunately One staff member at the front was lovely however she was the only one The others were outright rudeStayed in June

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Solo traveller<U+2022> Superior Twin Room<U+2022> Stayed 5 nights
content: ¡°Make Destination Beach Road your destination while in Singapore¡±
content_detail: The only inconvenience was the bed by the wall in the twin room in Rm  It gave me such a backache Thankfully I had the other bed which did not give me the problem You can't get more central to the city than the location of Destination The hotel stay met all my requirements beyond expectation The reception staff were super polite and accommodating The linen was pure white, changed every  days The gel soap dispenser is a brilliant idea The TV had a choice of channels all of which worked  The food court opp was a bonus More than anything else, I could not hear any noise from any other guests once I closed my door  Yay! I realise this is a relatively new hotel but please maintain the cleanliness of the bathroom, walls, carpet etc because I intend to return and have told everyone of DestinationStayed in June

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Couple<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 1 night
content_detail: No frills in the sense of no room service if you get hungry in the middle of the night or want ice cubes to chill a bottle of wine However, for the price, one can hardly complainThe lifts are alittle slow, small and few for a hotel of such size Especially during the morning rush for breakfast, the lift stops at every floor regardless of how full it already is Its a new property, opened only in  I believe Clean, simple and modern  Rooms are pretty spacious, with a couch next to the window Interestingly, the breakfast buffet platters have descriptions in both English and Hindi Go down early for breakfast to avoid the crowd Also, the pool is on the roof, which offers a nice view of the surrounding areasDestination Hotel is located right next to Goldenmile complex which serves authentic thai cuisine, and is opposite from Beach Road Hawker Centre, which serves authentic singapore fare at wallet friendly pricesStayed in June

content_detail: Nothing much Best value for a family trip We were a couple with  kids and the  beds in family roomwere extremely comfortable for all  of us The location is excellent with Nicole Highway MRT walking distance from the hotel We were told at checkin that breakfast for kids will be charged but on clarifying the online offer the kids were offered free breakfast with adults ( we didn't try the breakfast though) The rooftop swimming pool was a delight and view was excellent The rooms were cleaned daily and the coffee maker was a boon during the rains Will surely be back againStayed in May

content_detail: A communal smoking area, but I understand that may put others off Great location, staff delightful and very helpful, swimming pool amazing - spotlessly clean with fab views, excellent and varied breakfast buffet with hot dishes all being refilled before empty, and plenty of fruit, cheeses, cold meats and pastries  Some  areas being updated which will be good for everyone, but punches way above its weight, far more than a budget hotel Thank you DestStayed in June

content: ¡°Great for a short stay, if a little cramped¡±
content_detail: to  minute wait for the lifts in the morning (which wasn't optional as we were on a high floor with  small children) Lego and bits of food under the bed (our children appreciated the Lego, not so much the food!) In  days, we didn't find a single taxi driver who had heard of the hotel or knew where it was (both as 'Destination' and 'Premier Inn') The family room had adequate beds but it was very cramped and they took up ALL of the space in the room There was nowhere to put an open suitcase (except for on the bed) and we literally had to get onto the bed to pass each other in the room Children ate free at breakfast Breakfast reasonably priced and had a good selection Decent location Beds more than adequate for  adults and  children Quick check in and check outStayed in May

content: ¡°Very comfortable bed, good value for money stay.¡±
content_detail: We like to swim in a pool, rather than just lounge, so a bigger pool would have been nice, but we knew the size of the pool when we booked Booked this location because it was a Premier Inn at time of boooking, knowing that Premier Inn always provides a comfortable, fairly firm bed We were worried to find out the hotel had changed names a couple of days before we arrived (and no one had thought to tell us), particularly worried about the bed situation, but we needn't have been The bed was extremely comfortable Staff helpful and friendly Close to a metro station and a couple of stops takes you in to Marina Bay Sands area Also easy to walk into downtown area if you have the time Breakfast good and appeared competitively priced for restaurants Cheap local food court across the road if you fancy something different Served us well the morning we arrived and we had missed breakfast!Stayed in May

content: ¡°Cosy, quiet room, good value for family of four.¡±
content_detail: We paid for breakfast on the first day, but it wasn't worth $/adult, even though kids did eat free We didn't eat breakfast there again If it had been a better standard of food then we might have paid to eat there again (the bacon was not crispy, the cooked tomatoes were hard not soft, there were only scrambled eggs, the coffee was from a push button machine, not brewed, small selection of food) The cleaner on the second day did not seem to speak english, took one of our room cards by mistake, and did not remove our used towels Room was very quiet Extra thick doors,  and a notice by the lift asking for quiet between pm and am Close to public transport (MRT) and also easy to get a taxi from the Golden Mile complex next door Very good cheap Thai food available at the Golden Mile Complex The shower was very good Location is good Room is quite small, but our family of four stayed for seven days without a problem (and we are quite fussy) Very nice view of the river Blackout curtains very good Friendly, helpful reception staffStayed in April

content_detail: No halal food for muslim guestsWifi was not good It was hard to connect and too slow You have to stay at the lobby in order to have a good connection And I hope they would have a more friendly staff like mirah, accommodating and kind to whatever race their guests may came from The location was excellent Just go outside from the first level and you will find the bus rides on the other side So many bus to choose from and to take you where you want to go The mrt ride is just a few minute walk maybe - minutes and you will reach nicole highway stationNear kampong glam, arab street and bugis and the fahtima mosque is just a walk away, You just have to go thru the overpass that is connected directly to the hotel and on the other side you will find the masjid Good for muslims because it is also a walk from  halal foods that were abundant on the lower ground of the building below the overpass We appreciate one staff on the front desk named mirah cause she was kind and accommodating However, for muslims don't eat at the hotel because it might not be halal Overall the hotel was good, being at the center, it's near to every good locations when going around in Spore Every location is just a walk or mrt ride awaye<U+F><U+><U+>e<U+F><U+><U+>e<U+F><U+><U+> and lots of money chang<U+C>¡§r nearbyStayed in April

content: ¡°The main bed was full king size and very comfortable, TV was...¡±
content_detail: room size small, in my opinion, for the  Singapore dollars rate per night  The kingsize bed and the single bed took up nearly all the floor space The main bed was full king size and very comfortable, TV was large,  room was cleaned well every day, rooftop pool was fine, reception staff were helpful, printed boarding passes, etc  quickly and did not charge for them, Golden Mile Food Centre (for a variety of food stallsmost dishes were around - Singapore dollars) was right across the street, accessible by an overhead walkway; also next door to the hotel were several as  Thai restaurants, a convenience store as well as travel agents  Marina Bay is a half hour walk or about a $ taxi ride away, metro and bus stops are a short walk from the hotelStayed in April

content: ¡°Location was convenient and close to multiple MRT stations.¡±
content_detail: Rooms can be a little more practical Eg some towel rails etc would have been very helpful no hand bidets BTW! No shampoo/ conditioner were provided Location was convenient and close to multiple MRT stations Was also walking distance to the Arab Street area which has a lot of restaurants Room was rather small (though this is usual in Singapore) but comfortable and cozy The bed was nice and comfortable and the couch next to the window was a treat Towels were comfy and fluffy The rooftop pool was nice You can get a good night's sleep as there are no loud noises from the surrounding area or other guests Family friendly place On request I got a room with a lovely view, which made a huge difference, and there was a lot of natural light coming into my room Would definitely returnStayed in March

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Solo traveller<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 2 nights
content: ¡°A good hotel within easy reach of town¡±
content_detail: Was initially allocated an uncleaned room in error but thanks to the helpful staff at reception that was soon sorted The lifts were very busy and sometimes you had to wait a long time for one to arrive! Good quality accommodation at a reasonable price for Singapore standards Only a -minute walk to Nicoll Highway metro station and, if you don't mind walking in the heat, you can walk along Beach Road to the City Centre in about  minutesStayed in March

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Couple<U+2022> Superior Twin Room<U+2022> Stayed 3 nights
content: ¡°Not the best Premier Inn I've stayed in but good enough¡±
content_detail: The bathroom was relatively small and the shower layout means it's difficult not to wet the floor near the door The wifi was ok but cut off a few times during our stay Of most concern during our stay was the price of the breakfasts, which came to around  I've stayed in a lot of Premier Inn's in the UK and so booked into this one based on it being one of the more affordable hotels in a quite expensive city, and with the knowledge that I knew what kind of experience I was in for On arrival the staff allowed us to upgrade from a queen bed room to a king size room which was nice The rooms themselves are not that large however - big enough for us but others might want a bit more space The bed was comfortable and the pool on the roof was nice enough, although the weather was a bit hit and miss during our stay (as i got the impression it tends to be in Singapore) so came across as a little cold and windy Location was good, we were able to walk into the main central area of the city within about - minutes, but took the nearby metro on a couple of occasions too There are loads of nice restaurants in the area around the hotel, so plenty of choice thereStayed in March

content_detail: Serious issue with the hygienic and cleanliness I had "used" woman's underware fall off from where the hotel kept the spare pillows in the wardrobe It was tuck in between the  pillows  I called the front desk and house keeper came offered to "change" the pillow case" for me Few minutes later the shift manger came and apologised offered to change the room and breakfast will be a compliment She transferred me to another room and this is where I stepped on someone's else toe nails in the second room I could not be bother complain anymore If the pillow's case has been changed then the underware shouldnt be there I think as a hotel, pillow cases should be changed every time when they guests check out and new one came in It is not far from the MRT station, there are restaurants within walking distance Located in quiet street The breakfast was okayStayed in March

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Couple<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 5 nights
content_detail: There is a window in the room, but the view is very limited due to a nearby building of Golden Mile complex (but from the roof you can see Marina Bay)There is a  SGD deposit for every day of stay, although I must admit that it was returned to my card in only three operational days which is much better than hotels averagely doDoors on the second floor (near the reception) are closed at night so you have to go to the first floorLooks a bit expensive to me, but may be it's just Singapore prices Very nice and friendly personnel The hotel is new and very clean Photos of the rooms are up-to-dateThe location is not excellent, but many attractions are easily accessible Nicoll Highway MRT station of Circle Line (yellow) is about m away This line will easily take you to Marina Bay Downtown, China Town and Little India also can be reached in a reasonable time by MRT (line change required) Lavender MRT station of East West Line (green) is about m away (if you make a shortcut by Pedestrian Bridge over Rochor River) This line takes you to the Changi Airport in about  minutes Use bus No to go to Sentosa, the stop is about m from the hotel Big food center and ATMs just across the road (use bridge from the second floor) Pass the food center and you'll find a post office, post boxes and a / SAM machine (you can buy stamps here)Good soundproof of the rooms Quiet air-conditioning which can be regulated from the room Very comfort bed and nice linenSwimming pool on the roof was ok Rather small to have a good swim but enough wake you up in the morning or relax at the end of dayLuggage room is free of chargeStayed in March

content: ¡°Great room - enough space for two people, very comfortable...¡±
content_detail: The elevators! There are  elevators but seem not enough for this hotel Arm yourself with a lot of patience or take the stairsThe breakfast is too pricey There are better options nearby (try Maison Ikkoku in the Arab neighbourhood or Tolido's, they are excelent breakfast places and not pricey at all) Great room - enough space for two people, very comfortable bed, free water, really quiet (had a room on the th floor)- minutes on foot to the Nicoll Highway MRT station that is on the yellow Circle LineStayed in March

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Family with young children<U+2022> Family Room<U+2022> Stayed 3 nights
content: ¡°Great for Couples but NOT for families!!¡±
content_detail: Having stayed in a Family Room at the Premier Inn, Kingston Upon Thames, we were expecting a very similar facility However, this was NOT the case Upon entering our room, we discovered that what had been sold as a FAMILY ROOM, was in fact, a standard room with  beds SQUEEZED into it There was absolutely no room to move around We had  suitcases, as we had just spent  weeks travelling around Europe, and there was barely enough space to place  of them on the floor Also, the view from the windows (on both sides of the building), look out onto the neighbouring buildings There was so little room, that the Housekeeping staff just pulled the quilts up and tucked them down between the beds They changed the towels and this was the extent of "cleaning" The restaurant downstairs was located in the same area as the Reception desk This meant that while you were eating breakfast, you were subjected to the constant (and at times LOUD), noise of large groups of people checking in and out of the hotel You would also have to manoeuvre your way past several large stacks of luggage that people had left for the hotel staff to "hold" Breakfast in the hotel was also the most expensive we had encountered on our holiday At SGD per adult (kids ate FREE), it was a very average selection of dishes to choose from We found that if the restaurant was full, there wasn't a lot of space to move between tables, and even less when people had their prams seated by their tables I would not recommend this facility for families (especially those with young ones) The staff at the Premier Inn Singapore Beach Road were very welcoming and extremely helpful The location of the hotel is excellent, with the Nicoll Hwy MRT just around the corner ( minute walk) It is also not far from Bugis Street markets and eateries Great place for couplesStayed in March

content: ¡°Good hotel, great location and great value for money¡±
content_detail: There are three lifts and one was out of order when we were checking out It took really long to get a lift I sent a message with bookingcom to the hotel to request that they make my husband's birthday special and nothing was done I then requested a cake and was told that I need to make the request three days in advance and they asked if I'd like a slice of cake for S$ I declined that offer as I was very disappointed This hotel is perfectly located close to the Nicol highway mrt so we were able to get to all the touristy places with ease They allowed us early check in as our flight arrived really early and we were suffering from jet lag They made up the sleeper couch as a second bed for our daughter The room was clean and there were great views of the city and the bay Shops are close by for cheap foodStayed in February

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Group<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 2 nights
content: ¡°Really Disappointing service from a promising facility¡±
content_detail: For such a great physical facility the customer service is really a let down Staff always seemed distracted and when they did assist with a simple request, it seemed like such an effort, except for one lovely lady who really stood out on my last day (I wish I had remembered to take her name) I arrived in the evening for my stay just after midnight and no one assisted me with my bags so I struggled to my room They didn't even offer or say sorry no one is available  On arrival they hadn't deducted my payment (as all the other bookingcom hotels usually do) as they were trying to add an additional $ SGD as a security deposit which I was told was in case I ate at the restaurant which I had no intention of doing It wasn't an issue of me not having the money I use a separate debit card when I travel for all my accommodation and tour costs to come off of so I transfer money to it based on the invoices costs I had allocated for  the Singapore system of adding hotel taxes etc I just wish they had communicated this prior to my arrival so that I could have planned accordingly or transferred money across the day before Also no free breakfasts or any added value Advice: Get a service offering to match your promising facility and learn to go the extra mile and communicate any possible causes for inconvenience beforehand!!! Given the high cost of accommodation in Singapore the Premier Inn offers a good price for a great facility The hotel is new so everything is still in good condition The room was great with a big comfortable bed The bathroom could have been bigger but given that it is Singapore I guess it was OK It is also conveniently located about  minutes from the subway and a short ride from the Marina Bay hotspot areaStayed in January

content: ¡°Nice and Clean! Hotel accomodated to our request for room to be near lift.¡±
content_detail: We wondered how she came up with $ when the booking online was $ before tax Why would they need the ID of all the  guests and made it kind of a hassle?? The manager on duty also looks very strict We like the free parking and the kids love the vehile lift that brought us to the carpark! The bedsheets were clean and ample towels were given  bottles of mineral water were given and chilled in advance for you in the bar fridge Good quality hairdryer was also provided The auto torchlight was another little surprise The rooftop was extremely relaxing and towels were also available on all the deck chairs Overall great experience, just that the front desk lady spoke with a strong korean accent and I had a hard time trying to understandStayed in January

content: ¡°Cheap hotel, with low quality service. Dont expect too much!¡±
content_detail: Check in: We came before : and the staff immediately refuse us because the check in time is pm Finally i said can we just fill all the form and later take? At the end pm inside lobby is like in market, because all guest would like to get the keyThere is no smile, and they are all busy chit chat with each other at the back Only  senior who can handle it more properlyCleanliness: This is the worst part of this hotelOnce we go inside bathroom, we can smell 'sour smelly' from the toilet We tried not to compalain first and write down message in piece of paper And on the next day, its still same very stinky smell, and we just realize all the corner of the bathroom is not properly cleaned, there is a lot of depositAlso during first night both of us feel our skin is very itchy, but no wonder because on the second day we realize that they never vacum clean the carpet, there is a lot of small particle at cornerDust bin also not cleaned properly as we can found chocolate waste from our previous night Its consider new hotel, and the price Price consider lower compare with other hotelStayed in January

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Family with young children<U+2022> Family Room<U+2022> Stayed 3 nights
content_detail: We booked a 'family room' to sleep four, but a larger room would probably suit most families of  better, or be for a short stay Our beds were arranged as queen/portable/single sofa and this layout means that there is virtually no floor space at all, we had to have a suitcase under the desk The price was right, probably because I booked before the hotel opened Rooftop pool area was pleasant to relax in at the end of the dayThe adult breakfast rates include kids for free, and the breakfasts are great to start the day with Overall the location was fine but we did feel a bit 'off the pace' Taxis are easy and cheap to get but we did not do much in the area around the hotelStayed in January
